title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Despite allegations of sexual harassment, former World Bank official Rodrigo Chaves was elected president -- of which country?

A. Honduras

B. Costa Rica

C. Guatemala

D. El Salvador

---

2. Blockchain enthusiasts are using the initials "gm" all over the place. What do they stand for?

A. Great money

B. Good mining

C. Good morning

D. Got mine

---

3. Who just became Twitter's biggest shareholder by buying a 9% stake?

A. Jack Dorsey

B. Jeff Bezos

C. Elon Musk

D. Bill Gates

---

4. In the U.S., what fell to the lowest level since 1968?

A. Highway fatalities

B. New jobless claims

C. The number of homes on the market

D. The percentage of Americans born abroad

---

5. Whose starting salary just went up to between $95,000 and $110,000 a year?

A. New graduates of top 14 law schools

B. New graduates of top 20 MBA programs

C. Newly hired software developers

D. Walmart truck drivers

---

6. Carrie Lam said she won't seek a second term of office -- as what?

A. Hong Kong's Chief Executive

B. Taiwan's President

C. Mayor of Miami

D. McKinsey & Co.'s global managing partner

---

7. An Istanbul court halted the trial of Saudi officials charged with killing journalist Jamal Khashoggi. Why?

A. The escape of a suspect

B. Allegations of jury tampering

C. Turkey's desire to improve relations with Saudi Arabia

D. Plea negotiations reached a conclusion

---

8. The Major League Baseball season started -- with which of these rule changes?

A. Extra innings were abolished, so some games will end in ties.

B. Catchers will signal pitches electronically.

C. Defensive shifts were banned.

D. A pitch clock will keep hurlers on pace.

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. C

3. C

4. B

5. D

6. A

7. C

8. B
